basic_data.name: The Spa at The Old Mill

description: Escape your world and luxuriate in ultimate relaxation and wellness, where you can retreat for a time of personal indulgence or share the unforgettable experience with a loved one. We are committed to providing quality professional spa treatments, spa packages and personalized individual attention. Wrap yourself in a plush bathrobe and enjoy the tranquility of the Spa as you experience a customized spa package, created just for you. We provide the ideal escape for a relaxing couples getaway or individual and corporate retreats that are assured to relax, refresh, restore and revitalize both mind and body.

reviews.title: False Advertising for Spa Treatment
text: I booked a cellulite treatment for one of the areas offered, which on their website says, abdomen, buttocks, thighs and arms. I chose thighs. When I went for my service, I was told I could get the front, the inside of my thighs OR the back of my thighs done for $191 but not my whole thighs. I refused the partial service as described on the website and the Spa Director asked me into her office. It was was filthy, and there was a grossly stained upholstered bench that she asked me to sit on and of course I refused that too. I walked out wasting $4 parking and totally annoyed at people trying to scam with misleading wording on their website.

reviews.title: Ok experience
text: Enjoyed spending quality time for the afternoon with my future daughter in law.  Spa was disappointing and not the experience I was looking for. Not worth the cost and, aside from the massage of hands and feet during the mani pedi, could have gotten the same result in a walk in shop on Bloor Street. Was expecting more of a spa experience for $320 for two mani pedis including tax and tips

reviews.title: Lovely Way to Celebrate Retirement!
text: My cousin and I went for pedicures to celebrate my retirement.

The spa Director, Christina, made sure we had an excellent experience. The spa itself was lovey - very clean and elegant.  The two estheticians, Agnes and Annette, were very pleasant and provided  us with very professional service including a relaxing foot and lower leg massages.
Would definitely recommend.

reviews.title: Relaxing and incredible experience!
text: The best experience ever! I booked a package that included two massage sessions for my mother. It was a special day as was my mom's birthday and the first time she visited a Spa. She loved the special treatment she received. The experience was beyond her expectations. My mother even fell asleep during the session. Highly recommended!

reviews.title: Not very relaxing
text: I had a Groupon for a spa package that I paid C$135 for, it included the facial, a lip treatment, take home samples and a Latte.  This package was actually more than just the facial which was C$118 so I was guessing it would be a bit more relaxing.  Unfortunately, the facial was brisk and when it came time to put the moisturizer on my face the technician just slathered it on making it go up my nose, it felt a lot like I was being smothered and found myself holding my breath most of the time.  I did get a 25% discount on the products I liked which was nice, but the products in my take-home kit were something the technician told me not to use on my skin type so now I have a bunch of stuff I shouldn't even use.  My skin did feel great after the facial, but I was far more stressed than when I came into the spa.  If you want something relaxing I would check out some of the other places in the area or even in the city.

reviews.title: A perfect place for relaxing girls' getaway
text: My friend and I stayed at the Old Mill overnight and had spa treatments booked for the next day. I had a Swedish massage with Krystina (sp?) and then a Rosemary Mint Pedicure and Lavender Manicure with Agnes. The atmosphere is wonderfully relaxing and the staff friendly/welcoming. Agnes told me she loved working at the Old Mill, that staff were treated with respect.
My friend did the Hot Stone Massage and the French Pear & Chocolate Dip, and told me she loved everything (she also apparently fell asleep during one of the treatments; she was that relaxed!).

After our treatments, we did the Afternoon Tea. Beautifully presented and delicious! The chef came out afterward - so sweet and friendly. I was also impressed that a portion of the proceeds from Old Mill Toronto's Afternoon Tea is annually donated to the Women's Habitat charity.

Our rooms (I was in 502, my friend in 501) were beautifully appointed with a gorgeous view, much bigger than we expected. Only a few comments re: possible small improvements including improving the in-room audio system (cassette tape/CD player but no in-room tapes or CDs, outdated iHome that only accommodates older devices) and making sure the Where magazine is up-to-date - my room's issue were all for events that had already passed. I also notice that my curtain was starting to wear through a bit, with tiny holes that let sunlight through in the morning.
Both my friend and I had a wonderful and relaxing time, and we hope to come back again sometime.

reviews.title: Looks can be deceiving.....
text: Walked into a gorgeous establishment, went to my room, and the whole suite was beyond my expectations..large king bed, living room with fireplace, large jacuzzi tub...it really was nice...then, I leave for the day, return that evening....only to see my room looked terrible...nothing was done, except chocolates on the bed.  The bed was not made up, the coffee I accidentally spilt on the towel was still there, garbage not emptied..NOTHING !  I was very appalled...especially for the amount of money I paid!!!

The breakfast restaurant was great, and staff there were wonderful...but experiencing this unmade room, really turned me off!  I am an avid traveller, and have never had such an experience like this ever!!!  I would not return to this place...I received no apology or explanation when I talked to management.....not very professional at all!

reviews.title: Unexpected Bliss
text: I received a gift certificate for a massage and mani/pedi at the spa over two years ago. I completely forgot about it until about a month ago and decided to treat myself to a pre-birthday treat. I was somewhat sceptical having been to many spas around the world and found many to be overpriced and mediocre.

Well! I had an unexpectedly wonderful day. From the moment I walked in and was greeted at reception  until I left several hours later I had a blissful time. The quiet room is so relaxing with infused water and a great selection of herbal teas. The music throughout the spa was beautiful.
My massage with Bree was among the best I’ve ever had, and I go for a lot of massages. She was professional yet friendly and was perfectly responsive to the areas that needed work.
I then had a mani/pedi with Antoinetta. Could there possibly be a nicer person? She did a great job on my nails and made me feel like an absolute pampered princess.
On the day of my spa visit I was not feeling great. They both took such good care of me, bringing me tea and making sure I was warm enough.
I had a wonderful day and cant wait to go back. Thank you thank you!

reviews.title: Birthday Couples Massage
text: My wife arranged a couples massage for my birthday and it was an excellent experience. We have been coming to the Old Mill Spa for massages for years and most of the time the experience has been very good but this time the experience was excellent.
From the moment you arrive and are greeted by the staff to the massages the whole experience was excellent.

My massage therapist was Christina and she asked me beforehand of any issues I had and I was able to tell her to please focus on my back, shoulders and neck and be careful of my left knee which was injured many years ago from playing hockey. She also did a great scalp massage at the end too. Best massage I've had in years!
My wife had Belinda look after her and did an excellent job too.
We will be back in a few months for my wife's birthday too. Thanks Old Mill Spa!

reviews.title: Massage 45min
text: Great technique by RMTs. Clean and calm premises. Light complimentary refreshments. Especially liked the cold fruit infused, sparkling and bottled water available while waiting.

reviews.title: Does not respect Native people
text: This service continuously pushes their care products on you but chooses to disregard Revenue Canada and the Rights of First Nations people by refusing to recognize or accept Status Cards. This business is not worth supporting.

reviews.title: Spa Services not suitable for Working employees!!!
text: This review is written because the company doesn’t respect anyone’s schedule and no flexibility on their end. My sister was coming down from Victoria BC, to attend work conference in Ottawa. And my other sister decided to pick her up and celebrate the Bachelorette weekend in Toronto because she is part of the bridal party. My sister decided to pick this place because she belongs to the hospitality industry and she wanted to try out this place.  However, they only had Friday available for the bookings. She took down my sister’s credit card for 7 girls for 4:45 PM for Feb 03, 2017.  Both my sister didn’t end up coming in for their appointment because they got stuck in traffic coming down from Ottawa to Toronto and they got charged the same day for their services that they had booked off and never got a chance to redeem them because management couldn’t do anything about it even though she kept calling in to inform them about their situation.

Meanwhile, I was working on Friday obviously decided to leave early because I was coming from Oakville. So I left at 3:30 PM and got stuck in traffic. I get inside the spa late and the manager told me that I am not allowed for the full-services instead I can only get my nail polish changed to complete my manicure services. Anyhow, the girl who was performing was mute the entire time didn't say anything to me. I told her that my legs are little dry can you put lotion on my legs and instead she gives me the LOTION BOTTLE TO DO IT MYSELF. I was like okay now that's just rude that I am not even allowed to have her put lotion on my legs?

At this point, I was going to snap on her because I was paying $80 plus taxes just to get my nail polish changed with not a lot of options of nail polishes But I didn’t say anything because I didn’t wanted to ruin my entire night just because of her.  She finished everything by 6 PM and left the room without even saying anything. Anyhow, my friend was right beside me witnessing everything and we also saw another client who was getting his manicure done even after hours the woman still kept going to make sure his feet are nicely cleaned. I wouldn’t recommend this place to someone who is working full-time job on a weekday.

Today, after four days later my toenails are now chipping. And obviously I am going to call the manager to see what could be done in this situation.  Her response was “I know your calling so what is it that you want” and “I said something at least something” instead of another manicure services. I am only getting complimentary nail polish change again like why would I go back to Toronto to just get my nail polish changed.

Please don't waste your Money for this spa because there is better places out there in Toronto who actually understand if you’re coming from West-end. Please search them by reading reviews. This was not my first time using the Spa services at the Hotel just FYI. I am guessing these services are only good for people who are staying at the hotel and not working during the daytime.
Thank you for taking your time to read this review

reviews.title: Surprise bday Princess package
text: Staff were on time. Friendly.
Improvements: offer tea/coffee, or at least let me know where I can help myself. The beverage station was hidden.

I had my manicure done. They didn't have a drying station, manicurist led me to waiting area for pedicure appointment. I could have just moved to the pedicure chair and been offered a drink. I had to grab my own drink while my nail was still wet.

reviews.title: We had the Sunday Dinner Buffet
text: While driving there we thought we were going the wrong way & then suddenly it was almost like the city disappeared & we were at The Mill. Parking is right across the road for just $2 an hour. We enjoyed the fountain & gardens before going in for dinner. It was an exceptional buffet with something for everyone & a chocolate fountain for dessert. I could picture having a wedding here, it was beautiful.

reviews.title: Don't waste your time and money!
text: I have travelled to spas all over the world and within the city of Toronto and I have never been to one as poorly managed and kept as this! This spa is supposedly one of the best in the city? Do not go to this spa! It is dated and over-priced. The customer service is terrible! They have illogical policies that do not allow 17 year olds to have spa services even if they are accompanied by their parent. There are plenty of spas in Toronto. Save your time and money. Do not go to this one! This spa is not in downtown Toronto. If you are a tourist, do not bother making the trek out to this spa, it's not worth it!

reviews.title: Beautiful Inn and surroundings nestled in the Blood West Village
text: I stayed in a luxury King room in the Inn for three nights to attend a conference there. I have visited the Inn before, but only to attend a wedding reception. My family home is not far from the Inn along the Humber River, so the Inn has always been a familiar landmark.

The entire Inn is beautiful and is surrounded by a gorgeous park. The room was very large, as was the bathroom, which has a jacuzzi tub. The walls are papered with a tasteful pattern. The bed was very comfortable. The windows open, which is increasingly uncommon in hotels. The room was beautiful and soothing. The fireplace is a nice touch.

The service was outstanding, There is a turndown service at 6:00 pm. The room was very quiet, and I never heard any of my neighbours or any plumbing sounds, both of which can be very common in hotels. The room has a Keurig machine; I find these machines to be an environmental problem and, further, they make mediocre coffee. I travel with my own coffee and collapsible filter, and the staff was happy to provide me with a kettle. All the staff were helpful and gracious, and the manager phoned me the day I checked in to see if I was happy.

The only thing I didn't like was the room service breakfast. The options were limited: Either a continental or a full breakfast. There wasn't much in the way of ordering toast, for example. The continental breakfast contained a good, but very small croissant. The small Danish and other pastry were much too sweet. The coffee was not hot enough for my taste. The challenge with this location is that there are no surrounding cafes or restaurants within easy walking distance. The food I had during the conference was mediocre. So, lovely place to stay, with the exception of the food.

reviews.title: Amazing experience!
text: My wonderful boyfriend booked me the Duchess for a Day spa package for my birthday a couple weekends ago.  It was an amazing experience! The spa is located in the Old Mill Inn.  There is on site pay parking and you can enter through the hotel entrance.

Upon arrival, they had my booking all set.  Everyone is super professional - pleasant and polite.  The first person to meet me checked my coat and took me on a tour of the quiet room and change rooms.  They have lockers with combination locks to stowe your belongings.  You don't need to bring anything as they give you robes and sandals to wear.  (I just wore my underwear under the robe).

My spa attendant for the day was Antonetta (sp?)  She did all three of my services - she was AMAZING!  She loves her job and it really shows.  The first service was the English facial.  I've never had a facial before and it was the most luxurious thing ever!  It was bliss.  I'm not sure how many things she did, but there was cleansing, exfoliating, moisturizing plus other things including a massage of the face, upper body and scalp - SO nice.  I felt like I was floating!  Next up was the pedicure followed by manicure.  These were equally luxurious.  Antonetta really took care of me, getting me tea and biscotti, etc.  She did a fabulous job on the mani/pedi. The non-shellac polishes lasted almost 2 weeks for my nails and my pedi is still in great shape.  Well done!
I can't say enough about this place - I would definitely return again and would ask for Antonetta.  My boyfriend did a great job - note to others, this would make a great gift or girls day out!

reviews.title: Fantastic Christmas Massage at the Old Mill Spa
text: I bought a Groupon coupon for a couples massage including a 1hr massage, paraffin wax on hands and feet, latte and 20% off at the shop.
As Christmas was fully booked I was able to book an appointment on the Family Day weekend.
The massage was fantastic and totally relaxing!!  Kristina and Annette are so personable and kind not to mention great masseuses.
We truly felt pampered in the couples room.  Mid way through I was so content I was purring. The massage was head to toe and sooo wonderful.

The only downside to our experience was that we were told when we arrived that people who come in with a Groupon coupon leave a mandatory 15% tip.  We enjoyed our massage so much that we decided to leave a 15% tip for each masseuse and not overall.

As we were leaving we handed our tip envelopes to the front desk.  The young lady said it was awkward to ask but iterated the mandatory 15% protocol.  I told her what we did and she was relieved.  Yes, awkward!
I would probably book a massage directly with them next time but I think it would be better to add another $30 onto the coupon for the tip.

This is a smaller spa with no jacuzzi or steam room.  If you are looking for more this is not the place.  If you are looking for a massage I would definitely recommend it.  Ask for Kristina or Annette, they are fabulous.

reviews.title: Nice experience overall but with some exceptions
text: Went there to celebrate my BFF's birthday.  Atmosphere and people are super nice.  It is a very lovely place, and I love that the 'quiet' room is indeed quiet.  People were respectful in that room, unlike at other popular spas.  My only beef (besides the ridiculous prices, but that goes for all high end spas) was that the lady who massaged me decided that she was too tired to continue on my body and spent almost 15 irritating minutes massaging my scalp.  By the end of it I was less relaxed than when I started.  This, is my own fault,as I did not say anything.  Not knowing how much time I had left for the massage, I kept quiet.  I should have spoken up, but also, she should have been more balanced in her treatment.  She sat on a stool at my head and just worked on the scalp (my least favorite part) for what seemed like forever - but it was definitely around 15-20 minutes.  She rushed through the rest of the body.  The facial was okay.  Not the best I've had.  The Asian spas in Markham do a much better job with facials. But I wasn't there so much for the treatments as I was for the experience with my best friend.  That was aces.  This place is definitely a better choice than the Elmwood in Toronto.  If you want the zen like atmosphere.  If you want a social club experience, this isn't the place to go!!

reviews.title: A nice Getaway in the city
text: A great experience!
Without going out of the city we can enjoy a nice relaxing atmosphere
Siera and her colleague at reception greeted us warmly and took our coats.  They led us to the changing room explaining all we needed to know and offered us a nice specialty coffee

We enjoyed the lounge with nice snacks and a variety of teas and lemon/ cucumber water until our kind therapist came to meet us to take us to a very well kept room with fireplace and upscale finishings
The aromatherapy massage with paraffin wax was really good
Kristina and Annette were amazing and provided great relaxation
They were kind and attentive and skilled in the art of massage.  The music was great
Overall it was a great expérience. Everthing was clean and nice and i will certainly return
I recommend to anyone who wants to relax and enjoy a great atmosphere
Thank you

reviews.title: Don’t waste your money!!
text: The staff were awful and rude. The manicures all needed a touch up right after being done. Terrible paint job and they didn’t have shellac.

reviews.title: All Expectations were exceeded
text: It has very long time since Me and My wife have been visiting the Spa at The Old Mill and we absolutely Love it. We have made use of a variety of services such as manicure, pedicure, facials and massage therapies. We highly recommend it. The staff is very courteous and helpful. Can't wait to go back!

reviews.title: Best afternoon
text: I am not big on going to spas but last week a girlfriend convinced me to take some time out and pamper myself. We had the best time, the spa was great, the setting just spectacular and the staff were so nice. I can't remember the managers name; I think it was Christy, but she made us feel so welcome.
I had one of the best massages, in fact I actually fell asleep and apparently snored a bit :) (we had a chuckle about that).
Anyway, highly recommend this place; we had a great day.

reviews.title: Afternoon to relax
text: I recently had the opportunity to visit The Spa at The Old Mill. I decided to spend an afternoon of pampering so booked a pedicure, facial, & an aromatherapy/reflexology massage. I was at the spa for about 4 hours & enjoyed every minute of it. My afternoon started with the aromatherapy/reflexology which left me extremely relaxed, something I haven't experienced in a long time. The pedicure & facial were next & both services were wonderful. In between each service I was taken to the quiet room to wait for my next service & each time I was offered & served coffee &/or tea with delicious biscotti & a choice of flavoured waters. At the end of my services I relaxed in the quiet room without feeling rushed. Thank you to the staff of The Spa at The Old Mill for a wonderful experience.

reviews.title: Made me feel comfortable
text: I don't go to spas very often but my sibling treated me to a full day's services.  The staff were friendly, knowledgeable and highly skilled.  Not only did I enjoy the day but they discreetly helped show me the ropes.  I found it very relaxing which is what I needed after a stressful few months at work.

The workers were professional and helped explain what was happening.  Everything flowed smoothly and I had time to enjoy the comforts in between.  I can't tell you how much better I felt leaving.  Will definitely go back.

reviews.title: People Mill
text: Booked 3 treatments,  pedicure was average at best; pedicure my feet were sore for two days after a very brisk treatment; facial was excellent until they took me out to a public area in my robe and started to try to sell me overpriced skin products - I didn't want or ask for product advice.
It was a very busy day at the spa with packed waiting rooms and crowded women's change room.  Felt like I went ot a "people mill" where profit was at the expense of the customer experience.

reviews.title: $25 for shellac removal? Ridiculous.
text: I recently went to the Old Mill Spa with my friend for pedicures and the woman doing mine informed me that removing my shellac nail polish on my toed would cost $25.00 when at other spas they charge $5. The woman giving my pedicure was also unhappy at the fact that it was going to take 15 mins longer than expected. So, she spoke to the front desk and decided that I should get a mini-pedicure instead. I paid $25 for a fee that I wasnt aware I was going to be charged and didnt end up with the pedicure i wanted. None of which was my fault. If it's that big of a thing and you intend on maintaining your $25 removal fee, you may want to ask and/or mention this to your clients before they arrive. Not tasteful at all in my opinion. My first and last time there.
